Posts.Content: Feb 26, 2009 12:06PM juliejfsrj wrote: ejlj,    What are you currently doing as far as treatment?  I recently finished my year of herceptin and am contemplating going back on low dose methotrexate to combat spread of arthritis damage.
Posts.Title: Immune system problems and cancer related? ailenroc orange1

Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2009 07:10PM juliejfsrj wrote: I also suffered from axilkary web syndrome.  I teach ballet and had great difficulty.  I went back to my bikram or hot yoga classes unable to keep my arm up.  After 3 months, everything was back to normal.  Stretching in the intense heat helped me work through the tightness much faster!
Posts.Title: Eeek - a CORD! I'm freaking out... Kleenex knowledgeforpower

Posts.Content: Feb 26, 2009 10:51AM juliejfsrj wrote: I have ankylosing spondylitis which is a form of arthritis in which the body produces an almost bone like structure which fuses the joints together.  My pelvis, part of my spine and neck are fused.  At first, I thought the cancer was related to the fact that I took methotrexate as a way of relieving the pain.  This is a chemotherapy drug which suppresses the immune system.  My oncologist feels my cancer may have more to do with the ankylosing spondylitis rather than over exposure to radiation and powerful medicines. One thing I will say...my rheumatologist  says my immune system is overactive.  Why wouldn't it kill off these cancer cells?  I am very rarely sick, and never thought this would happen!
Posts.Title: Immune system problems and cancer related? ailenroc orange1
